subclassFeature.name: Circle of the Treesinger
entries: The druidic tradition runs deep in elven blood; it may be the first druids were elves living in the Feywild. Although elven druids are mastered every circle, they hold the ancient way of treesinging close to their heart. These druids tend to the green growing things of their communities above all else, from new sprouts in the fertile spring soil to towering redwoods and ancient, magical trees as old as the land itself. These druids travel between elven communities—most often farflung wood and wild elf settlements—helping their people live in harmony with the trees that shield them. Many hold Rillifane Rallathil sacred and even proclaim to hear the Many-Branched god in the rustling of leaves.

Druids in the Circle of the Treesinger are able to awaken a small tree to travel with them as an ally. While other druids focus on taking the form of great beasts, treesingers have mastered plant forms. These druids can enhance their allies, while commanding a stout presence during battle.

subclassFeature.name: Sacred Tree
entries: Circle of the Treesinger druids hold a single type of tree to be most sacred. They often adorn themselves with carefully cut pieces from these trees, and see omens in the patterns in their bark. Either roll on the table below or choose an option that fits your character.

subclassFeature.name: Circle Spells
entries: Your mystical connection to trees infuses you with the ability to cast certain spells. At 2nd, 3rd, 5th, 7th, and 9th level you gain access to circle spells connected to trees and other plants.

Once you gain access to one of these spells, you always have it prepared, and it doesn't count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. If you gain access to a spell that doesn't appear on the druid spell list, the spell is nonetheless a druid spell for you.

subclassFeature.name: Treesinger’s Ally
entries: At 2nd level, you can spend 4 hours singing to a young tree to awaken it {@creature Treesinger's Ally|Bence Homebrew: Subclass|(see sidebar for the companion’s statistics)}. It accompanies you on your adventures and fights alongside you. Add your proficiency bonus to the companion’s attack rolls and damage rolls. Its hit point maximum equals the hit point number in its stat block or four times your druid level, whichever is higher. Like any creature, it can spend Hit Dice during a short rest to regain hit points.

The companion obeys your commands as best as it can. It takes its turn on your initiative. On your turn, you can verbally command the companion where to move (no action required by you). You can use your action to verbally command it to take the {@action Attack}, {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, or {@action Help} action. If you don't issue a command, the companion takes the {@action Dodge} action. Once you reach 6th level in this class, you can use a bonus action to command the companion to take the {@action Attack} action.

If you are {@condition incapacitated} or absent, the companion acts on its own, focusing on protecting you and itself. The companion never requires your command to use its reaction, such as when making an opportunity attack
If your companion dies, you can obtain a new one by spending 4 hours singing to a young tree to awaken it.

subclassFeature.name: Heartwood Infusion
entries: Also at 2nd level, when you awaken and bind to a companion using your Treesinger’s Ally feature, choose one of the following features to add to your companion.

entries.name: Heart of Ash
entries: You can use your action to command your companion to touch a creature and restore {@dice 2d8} hit points. Constructs and undead are not affected by this feature
The companion can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once). The companion regains all uses of this feature when they finish a long rest.
Once you reach 10th level in this class, the healing increases to {@dice 3d8}.

entries.name: Heart of Elder
entries: You can use your action to command your companion to curse a creature within 30 feet of it. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC equals your druid spell save DC) or have disadvantage on the next saving throw it makes before the end of your next turn. The companion must finish a short or long rest before using this feature again.

entries.name: Heart of Oak
entries: The companion gains a +3 bonus to its AC. Once you reach 6th level in this class, it gains proficiency in Strength and Constitution saving throws. At 10th level in this class, the AC bonus increases to +4 and the companions Hit Die increase to d10s.

entries.name: Heart of Yew
entries: When the companion hits a target with their slam attack, the target must make a Constitution saving throw (DC equals your druid spell save DC) or become {@condition poisoned} until the end of their next turn

subclassFeature.name: Tree Shapes
entries: Starting at 6th level you can transform into a plant creature. You can use your Wild Shape feature to transform into {@filter a plant with a challenge rating as high as your druid level divided by 3, rounded down|bestiary|challenge rating=[&0;&2]|type=plant}.

subclassFeature.name: Share Spells
entries: Beginning at 10th level, if you cast a spell targeting only yourself, you can also affect your companion, if it is within 30 feet of you. You cannot change the companion’s shape, such as with {@spell polymorph}, in this way.

subclassFeature.name: Song of Life
entries: Beginning at 14th level, you can sing an ancient Druidic song to a Huge or smaller tree within 10 feet of you for 10 minutes. After the song is complete, the tree is awakened as if through the {@spell awaken} spell. You can have up to two trees charmed in this way at a time. If you use this feature to awaken another tree, the oldest tree still charmed by you is no longer charmed, and may either remain friendly to you or, more likely, pursue its own goals. You can use this feature in this way once every 7 days.
Additionally, once per day, during a short rest, you can sing a verse of the song to your companion, restoring all of its hit points.

monster.name: Treesinger's Ally
languages: One language that you know (typically Druidic or Elvish)

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the companion remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal tree.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.
